label: biopsy
definition: A specimen collection that obtains a sample of tissue or cell from a living multicellular organism body for diagnostic purposes by means intended to be minimally invasive.
example of usage: Biopsy of a potentially cancerous mole.

label: image guided biopsy
alternative label: image-guided biopsy|imaging guided biopsy|image guided needle biopsy
definition: A biopsy which uses an imaging procedure to guide a needle biopsy.
example of usage: Image-guided needle biopsy allows a doctor to biopsy suspicious areas that aren't readily seen or felt through skin, such as in a prostate gland.

label: computed tomography assisted biopsy
alternative label: Computed Tomography Assisted Biopsy|CT Guided Biopsy|CT Assisted Biopsy|Computed Tomography-Guided Needle Biopsy
definition: A needle biopsy guided by real-time computed tomography (CT) scan images.
example of usage: A CT Guided Biopsy is a procedure performed by a radiologist to obtain a small tissue sample through a needle.

label: ultrasound-guided needle biopsy
definition: A needle biopsy guided by ultrasound visualization.
example of usage: An ultrasound-guided needle biopsy uses sound waves to help locate a nodule or abnormality within the thyroid.

label: needle biopsy
definition: A biopsy that uses a hollow needle to extract cells.
example of usage: A needle biopsy is often used on suspicious breast lumps and enlarged lymph nodes that a doctor can feel through a patient's skin.

label: fine needle aspiration biopsy
definition: A biopsy that uses a thin needle to extract cells.
example of usage: A fine needle aspiration biopsy is commonly performed in order to test for cancer.
term editor: Chris Stoeckert, Helena Ellis, Jie Zheng

label: core needle biopsy
definition: A biopsy that uses a hollow tube to collect a core of tissue.
example of usage: A core needle biopsy can remove more tissue than a fine needle biopsy, and therefore can provide more information about the cells and tissue removed.
term editor: Chris Stoeckert, Helena Ellis, Jie Zheng

label: surgical biopsy
definition: A biopsy involving a surgical incision into an organism to access the biopsy material.
example of usage: Surgical biopsy may be required to collect hard-to-reach tissue.

label: abdominal wall fat pad biopsy
definition: A biopsy involving the collection of a small part of the abdominal wall fat pad.
example of usage: The makeup of fat in the abdominal wall can be investigated by fat biopsy.

label: tail biopsy
definition: A biopsy involving the collection of the tip of a mamallian tail.
example of usage: A mouse tail biopsy was performed to collect material for DNA extraction.

label: bone marrow biopsy
definition: A biopsy where a small amount of bone and a small amount of fluid and bone marrow are collected.
example of usage: A bone marrow biopsy removes bone with the marrow inside to look at under a microscope

label: skinpunch biopsy
definition: A biopsy that involves the collection of a cylinder of skin (including epidermis, dermis and superficial fat) using a punch tool.
example of usage: A three or four millimeter punch is used in s skinpunch biopsy proceedure.

label: vacuum-assisted biopsy
definition: A biopsy performed with a needle augmented with a vacuum device.
example of usage: A vacuum assisted biopsy can remove an area of abnormal cells from breast tissue.
